transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_00
transcript.text: That's wrong.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_00
transcript.text: Oh, Sheldon, put your hand down.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_02
transcript.text: Sorry, please continue.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_02
transcript.text: It's okay, Mary. It's Sheldon, right?

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_02
transcript.text: Yes, sir.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_02
transcript.text: Well, Sheldon, why don't you come on up here and tell me how I'm wrong? No. Okay.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_02
transcript.text: Let's give him a hand, everybody.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_02
transcript.text: What's happening?

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_02
transcript.text: Sheldon's gonna eat him alive.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_02
transcript.text: So?

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_00
transcript.text: You've confused possibilities with probabilities. According to your analogy, when I go home, I might find a million dollars on my bed, or I might not. In what universe is that 50-50?

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_02
transcript.text: So what do you think the odds are that God exists?

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_00
transcript.text: I think they're zero. I believe in science.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_02
transcript.text: So you don't think science and religion can go hand-in-hand?

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_00
transcript.text: Science is facts. Religion is faith.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_00
transcript.text: I prefer facts.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_02
transcript.text: I understand that.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_02
transcript.text: Here's a cool fact for you. A lot of famous scientists believed in God.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_02
transcript.text: Isaac Newton, Albert Einstein, even Charles Darwin.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_00
transcript.text: So Darwin's right about God and wrong about evolution?

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_02
transcript.text: Now you're getting it. Let's give it up for Sheldon, everybody.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_02
transcript.text: What a good sport.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_01
transcript.text: But I wasn't a good sport.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_01
transcript.text: At that moment, I vowed to come back the following Sunday and destroy Pastor Jeff.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_02
transcript.text: Good.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_00
transcript.text: Oh, here we go.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_02
transcript.text: Yes, Sheldon?

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_00
transcript.text: You said he didn't create the sun until day four.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_00
transcript.text: Yeah. So how could there be light the first three days?

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_02
transcript.text: God is light. So God's a photon.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_02
transcript.text: God's what made photons possible.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_00
transcript.text: And what day did he do that?

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_02
transcript.text: I would think day one.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_01
transcript.text: If I grab my chest and keel over, maybe we can get out of here.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_00
transcript.text: That's a terrible thing to say.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_02
transcript.text: Because the first day had just begun.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_00
transcript.text: So before the big bang?

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_02
transcript.text: There was no big bang. There was only the word.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_00
transcript.text: Was the word kaboom?

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_01
transcript.text: Okay, do it.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_01
transcript.text: We gotta go.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_00
transcript.text: What's happening? Is it over?

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_01
transcript.text: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_02
transcript.text: Yeah. Yeah. Yeah.
